page.title: 02 RESIDENTIAL PROBLEMS.
page.content: The people interviewed represented nearly all possible age-groups, although there was a high percentage of young people. The vast majority of people had moved from the surrounding area (Northampton, Kettering, Bedford) although one family emigrated from Rhodesia when it became Zimbabwe. They had lived on the estate for anything between 18 months and 14 years. Most people are happy with the locality and the only complaint was that there is no local shop. Most people shop in central Wellingborough and all except one had a car. The majority like the peace and tranquility of the estate and were delighted not to be living in the town centre. Few people could think of areas to improve Redwell Grange. Geoffrey Futer.
